p: Avian influenza is a viral disease caused by H5N1, a highly virulent strain of the influenza-A virus, that has the potential to cause a global pandemic (CDC 2006; WHO 2006c). The ecological interactions contributing to the transcontinental spread of the disease is illustrated in Fig.Â 8.2. As shown in the figure, infected migrating waterfowl, in which the virus is endemic, are the primary vectors for causing intercontinental spread of the disease (Normile 2006).
